com.mvp4g.client.history
Class PlaceService

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.client.history.PlaceService
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>, com.google.gwt.event.shared.EventHandler
public class PlaceService
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>

Place Service defines the connection between the application and the history.

When an event needs to be stored in the history, the place method of PlaceService by the Command instance in charge of an event.

When the History token changes, the onValueChange method is called.

The PlaceService convert an event to a History token the following way:

myurl#eventType?params

where params is the string returned by the convertToToken method of the converter associated with the event.
If params is null, then the URL will be:

myurl#eventType

Author:
plcoirier

Nested Class Summary
static interface PlaceService.HistoryProxy
          Interface to define methods needed to manage history

This interface is needed in order to test the PlaceService without using GWT History class.
GWT History class can't be used with JUnit test.

 void onValueChange(com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeEvent<java.lang.String> event)
          Called when the History token has changed.

Decode the history token and call the convertFromToken method of the history converters associated with this action stored in the token.

If token is equal to empty string, ask the event bus to dispatch an initEvent.
 void place(java.lang.String eventType, java.lang.Object form)
          Convert an event and its associated object to a token.

The object is converted to a string thanks to the history converter associated with the event.
 void setInitEvent(java.lang.String initEvent)
          Set the event to send in case the history token is equal to null or empty string.

Method Detail

onValueChange

public void onValueChange(com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeEvent<java.lang.String> event)
Called when the History token has changed.

Decode the history token and call the convertFromToken method of the history converters associated with this action stored in the token.

If token is equal to empty string, ask the event bus to dispatch an initEvent.

Specified by:
onValueChange in interface com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ValueChangeHandler<java.lang.String>
Parameters:
event - event containing the new history token

place

public void place(java.lang.String eventType,
                  java.lang.Object form)
Convert an event and its associated object to a token.

The object is converted to a string thanks to the history converter associated with the event.

Parameters:
eventType - type of the event to store
form - object associated with the event
